Description:
The NFS, Executive Director - Construction Acquisition (ED-CA) supervises the NCAL Construction Acquisition Business Line (NCABL) ensuring that functional direction is provided to all NFS regional personnel with regard to the Business Line areas of responsibility. The ED-CA ensures policies, procedures, and processes are consistently communicated, coordinated, and implemented. The ED-CA is responsible for the hiring and resource allocation for personnel performing NCABL functions working in collaboration with the Executive Director of Operations (EDO) and the Executive Director of Strategy Planning and Design (EDSPD). Responsible for assuring delivery of regional projects on time and within budget parameters. Works with EDO, as well as with other Business and Support Lines, to deliver the regional capital plan. Assures that Capital Acquisition Request (CAR) documents are developed with budget and schedule information consistent with approved estimating and scheduling procedures. Approves CAR document budget and schedule estimates for design and construction projects. Manages all Construction Acquisition Business Line operations with the NCAL Region, and assures business line community of practice initiatives are carried out in the NCAL Region.


Essential Responsibilities:
- Construction Acquisition Business Line Regional Leader
- Key advisor to NFS Regional VP and Executive Director of Operations
- Direct Supervisor of the Director of Construction Management, Capital Projects Facility Construction, Contracts, Inspection Services, and Safety departments within the NCAL Region.
- Collaborates and coordinates with Executive Director of Facilities Planning and Design and other Business and Support Lines
Basic Qualifications:
Experience
- Minimum ten (10) years experience in large-scale, technically complex capital construction projects.
- Minimum ten (10) years experience in construction or operational management.
Education
- Bachelor-s degree in Construction Management, Architecture, Structural or Electrical Engineering, Construction Management, or related field.
License, Certification, Registration
- N/A.

Additional Requirements:
- Expert knowledge and oversight experience in a multi-site design and construction management organization.
- Inpatient construction management background working in an operating facility environment with OSHPD experience critical and necessary.
- Demonstrated background of leading, building relationships, and influencing senior matrix executives with a cooperative, risk-taking, fact-driven consultative style balanced by a strong results and customer service orientation.
- Demonstrated technical leadership background of building and or renovating medical facilities using union labor forces.
- Extensive experience in leading, recruiting, developing, and retaining high-performing teams and producing project results within schedule and budget.
- Demonstrated program and financial oversight of facilities programs comprising hundreds of projects with budgets exceeding $1.5 billion.
- Significant experience in leading a team of professionals and skilled trade personnel providing integrated construction management services to numerous clients.
- Demonstrated enterprise-wide, vertical and horizontal communication skills (written, presentations, oral and listening).
- Demonstrated system leadership success in a collaborative, matrix organization.

 
Preferred Qualifications:
- Healthcare facilities preferred.
- Master-s degree preferred
- Professional Construction Management certification, Professional Engineer, Registered Architect or License in related field preferred.

This is a permanent, full time position offering a competitive salary and benefits package.
Responsibilities:
Visit multiple job sites to ensure federal and state safety regulations are being exceeded.
Manage safety for crews and assist foremen and project managers.
Teach construction safety 30-hour classes.
Meet with OSHA 500 and safety regulators.
Communicate with Safety Director and additional internal and jobsite staff.
Requirements:
3+ years of construction safety experience working on large commercial projects: schools, hospitals, airports, high-rises, hotels, stadiums, data centers, commercial buildings, among others.
Familiar with Federal and State Safety regulations and requirements.
OSHA 500 among other safety certifications preferred.

The San Francisco, CA branch is searching for a Senior Project Manager to oversee a very large project anticipated to take approximately 2.5 years. Job Responsibilities This is a design-assist project, meaning that the project manager will need to be well versed in the building services equipment installation systems, as well as general technical knowledge to coordinate with:
Project Structural Engineer and construction,
Mechanical/Electrical/Plumbing coordination,
Architectural finishes, CA specific code related requirements, etc.
Candidate will also need to have a solid foundation of best installation practices and with equipment and site logistics needs for hoisting and rigging, storage, offload locations, etc. Some of the duties required include, but not limited to:
Coordinating all contract activities from the project award stage to completion of the equipment installation and provide a progress review of projects to ensure that contract documents are consistent with the required scope of the project.
Communicate directly with multiple representatives of the general contractors, owners, architects and designers, also State and Local authorities and regulatory agencies concerning project design, preparations, and scheduling of installation for the equipment.
Candidate will also work closely with the internal sales staff, construction superintendents and senior leadership to ensure a successful project from both the financial and customer perspectives.
Take lead on weekly Major Project Reviews
Manage subcontractor schedules and site performance (and vendors)
Enforce safe work environment is established in all working areas
Assist with training an associate Project Manager
Qualifications
Candidate should have a minimum of 7-10 years of industry project management experience. Knowledge of the principals of cost estimating, scheduling and contract administration.  Ability to accurately interpret construction contractual documents and contract modifications to determine cost of such change. Accurately analyze situations and assist in developing contingencies for estimates Ability to read and review architectural and structural drawings Must possess proficient oral and written communication and presentation skills and be able to communicate effectively with wide variety of people with diverse background of all levels and disciplines. Must be able to develop and maintain positive, cooperative, team-oriented relationships with co-workers, supervisors, managers, clients and others in contact with the job.
Education
Bachelor’s degree in engineering, architecture, construction management or business administration required.
 An EEO employer.

Reference # : 18-05927 Title : Construction Safety Expert Construction Manager (CSE/CM/GC)
Location : South San Francisco, CA
Experience Level : Start Date / End Date : 04/18/2018 / 12/31/2019  
Description
Construction Safety Expert (CSE/R) / Construction Safety Expert Construction Manager (CSE/CM/GC)
Needed Onsite in South San Francisco, CA
12-36+ Month Contract

Typical Minimum Requirements
Education:
· Accredited (Technical or Applied Science) University Construction Safety degree or equivalent
· Professional Construction Safety Expert (CM/GC) have a minimum professional qualification of OSHA 30/10 trainer (USA), Construction Health and Safety Technician (CHST) (USA)
· Minimum SIX (6) years of construction safety experience

Job Summary
· Minimize the potential for injury or other loss by using an independent judgment based on a mixture of knowledge and "safety-first? experience
· Promote occupational health and safety consciousness among all project employees
· Engage in the project during the design phase to identify and assess hazards and risks in an early stage of the project
· Control the Company's construction occupational health and safety standards, policies and targets on the project, or
· Lead the Company's construction occupational health and safety standards, policies and targets on the project directly, depending on the project size or identified project risk potential
· CSE/R: Reports directly to the project management office during the project duration
· CSE/CM/GC: Reports directly to the CM during the project duration

Duties and Responsibilities
· Define clear roles & responsibilities between Construction Safety Expert and CM
During Planning
· Monitor, control and implement legal and Company's construction occupational health and safety standards, policies and targets into the project
· Identify ways to avoid risks to construction occupational health and safety
· Analyse, evaluate and give advising feedback to the construction safety risk analysis, hazard assessments and safety pre task planning. (Risk Assessments, Job Hazard Analysis, etc.)
· Give input to tenders and contract documents regarding construction occupational health and safety. If necessary, participate in the bid review and award
· Review or assist with the creation of the construction site safety management plan, assembly concepts and construction SHE site management plan
· Provide advice during scheduling, especially when reconciling construction activities, durations and trade stacking (different types of construction in the same area) to prevent/avoid dangers caused by coexistence

During Construction
· Monitor, control and implement legal and Company's construction occupational health and safety standards, policies and targets into the project
· Analyse, evaluate and advise feedback to the construction safety risk analysis, hazard assessments and safety pre task planning. (Risk Assessments, Job Hazard Analysis, etc.)
· Determine safety and health-relevant interactions between the work of the individual trades on the construction site and other operational activities or influences near the construction site
· Organise the co-operation of the construction companies with regard to construction safety and health through regular participation in construction coordination and safety meetings
· Advise the CM / GC/ contractor construction managers regarding implementation of requirements of the construction occupational health and safety
· Review of the agreed safeguards for implementation and effectiveness
· Execute, evaluate and maintain necessary construction safety inspections and audits regarding assembly concepts, logistics plan and construction site regime
· Conduct and lead incident investigations and assures timely reporting. Investigations include root cause and corrective actions to closure
· Maintain records, reports, and documents to meet company or regulatory requirements
· Advise, supervise and train employees assigned to project in construction safety matters
· Develop, upgrade, and manage construction safety site programs, including recommendation for awards and recognition programs
· Maintain interface with site's representatives, insurance bodies, the construction project safety community, and the corporate construction safety expert
· Perform at least daily construction safety walks
· Unlimited authority to intervene in case of dangerous situations or proactively in order to avoid accidents
· CSE/R: Is responsible for personal discipline management and can send workers off the construction site

POSITION OVERVIEW:
SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory is seeking a Senior Construction Project Manager to deliver world-class design and construction of facilities and infrastructure projects in support of world-changing scientific research. In this role, the project manager will be responsible for planning, developing, procurement, design, construction, and close-out/transition to operations of projects ($100k - $20M). SLAC currently has multiple ongoing projects to improve scientific research capabilities and to maintain existing infrastructure, including offices, administrative spaces, scientific laboratories, cleanrooms, and campus-wide supporting civil infrastructure.
In addition to core duties, responsibilities include the following: manage project cost, schedule, technical scope, and risk; organize and hold readiness reviews; identify and manage project risks to navigate cost, schedule, and scope constraints. Gather, organize and disseminate specifications and requirements. Integrate Environmental Safety & Health (ES&H) considerations in planning, design and construction of facilities; implement SLAC ES&H policy and best practices in construction. Oversee general contractor activities such as safety, configuration, cost and schedule control; ensure that construction conforms to SLAC policies and engineering specifications under very dynamic working conditions. This position will liaise with a broad range of client groups and stakeholders, including SLAC scientists and physicists, management and operations, finance and contracting, facilities maintenance experts, and other project stakeholders. The senior project manager will also present project information to various stakeholders, including the DOE in Project Status Peer Reviews, SLAC Laboratory Management, and the prospective user community.
This position is an employee of Stanford University, providing support to the Department of Energy (DOE) contract at SLAC National Accelerator Laboratory. This position requires the highest personal and professional commitment to delivering safe, quality design and construction performance. This position reports to the Infrastructure Projects Group within the Facilities and Operations (F&O) Design and Construction Services (DCS) team.
JOB PURPOSE:
Manage large and complex projects with high performance risk, driving project(s) to completion. May manage more than one large project simultaneously. Work is typically comprised of 80% time contribution towards project leadership and 20% as a technical contributor.
CORE DUTIES*:
Perform the full range of project management cycle: initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing. Independently lead and direct projects requiring high levels of functional integration and involving multiple disciplines to be managed.
Direct development of an action plan, and estimate requirements for resources, including management, labor, materials, and time required to complete project.
Facilitate discussions and negotiations to drive recommendation consensus.
Develop and help execute comprehensive change management strategy and communication plan relative to project scope and stakeholders; orchestrate and lead change management methodologies underlying project success.
These elements typically delineate the project management involved at this level: Charter origination or scope identification and shaping, scope definition; # of disciplines/stakeholders to manage is across university-wide impact, and city, county constituents; risk-manage, control and report on risk associated with more complicated projects, affecting division or program as it relates to their project portfolio and risk sharing and control is skewed further to the project manager: project complexity involves synthesizing complex technical data and driving decisions; primary university relationship is at the senior associate/administrative dean, faculty and directors level: single project budget/scope accountability-up to $10M; cumulative budget/scope accountability over $10M.
* - Other duties may also be assigned
Note: This is a 24 months fixed term position with the possibility of extension or conversion to a regular- continuing position.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering (especially Electrical, Mechanical, or Civil), Architecture, Construction Management, or related field and five years of experience in management of projects with extensive size/complexity and moderate performance risk, including project planning, scheduling, tracking, and budgeting or a combination of education and relevant experience including:
Overseeing contract procurement, personnel selection and performance management, communications with contractors and vendors, contract negotiation, change control, and earned-value measurement.
Performing project engineering and project controls of complex industrial or commercial projects and substantial experience in civil, building, mechanical, electrical, and utility construction.
Testing, special inspection, permitting, and system commissioning.
Various project delivery methods (including design-build and design-bid-build)
Construction project estimating (parametric, unit costs, RS Means, etc.)
Construction quality management and assurance
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Highly effective written and oral communication skills to address a wide variety of audiences and be able to convey complex technical information and project objectives to various audiences, including: construction contractors, architects and engineers, supported clients, financial and contracting personnel, senior SLAC leadership, and distinguished visitors.
Ability to productively assemble, engage, and lead cross-functional teams. This entails the ability to coordinate with multiple project stakeholders, guide the team to successful decision-making, and lead the team to successfully meet all project goals and deadlines.
Demonstrated project management ability to employ integration of scope, time management, cost, quality, human resources communications, risk, and procurement components.
Ability to balance customer expectations with project reality.
Demonstrated resilience, diplomacy, influence, relationship building, and problem solving in a various situations.
Keen grasp of interpersonal and impact awareness.
Depth of knowledge in technical discipline/domain needed to deliver projects. Thorough knowledge of industry best practices in design and construction.
Demonstrated ability to read, comprehend, and interpret multi-disciplinary construction engineering documents, including specifications and contract drawings.
Evaluate and approve design and construction schedules in compliance with contract documents.
Coordinate, evaluate, and process all RFIs, submittals and change orders in a timely manner.
Must demonstrate strongest commitment to construction safety, including construction safety knowledge, field experience, and commitment to proactive safety planning and compliance.
Must be a team-player, willing and able to work in a highly collaborative organization, striving to continuously improve delivery of design and construction through continuous process improvement.
Must be a team-leader, with a passion for doing it right the first time, able to influence project partners to collaboratively and safely deliver high-quality projects on schedule and within budget.
The following experience, knowledge, skills and abilities are preferred but not required:
10+ years of progressive project leadership experience with design and construction projects.
Working knowledge of Primavera P6, MS Project, and collaborative project-management software.
Multi-year public-funded construction projects.
Pull-planning or Last Planner® System
Design and construction experience for specialized laboratories, clean rooms, and experimental science
Coordinating with and supporting various project stakeholders in a matrix organization
Successfully commissioning highly technical electrical and mechanical systems.
Experience in managing technical facilities construction projects.
Certifications and Licenses:
Project Management (PMI), Project Management Professional (PMP) preferred
Engineer in training (EIT), Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) certification, Professional Engineer (PE) license, or Registered Architect (RA) preferred.
SLAC Employee Competencies:
Effective Decisions: Uses job knowledge and solid judgment to make quality decisions in a timely manner.
Self-Development: Pursues a variety of venues and opportunities to continue learning and developing.
Dependability: Can be counted on to deliver results with a sense of personal responsibility for expected outcomes.
Initiative: Pursues work and interactions proactively with optimism, positive energy, and motivation to move things forward.
Adaptability: Flexes as needed when change occurs, maintains an open outlook while adjusting and accommodating changes.
Communication:   Ensures effective information flow to various audiences and creates and delivers clear, appropriate written, spoken, presented messages.
Relationships: Builds relationships to foster trust, collaboration, and a positive climate to achieve common goals.
Job-Specific Competencies:
Action Oriented: Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm.
Plans and Aligns: Plans and prioritizes work to meet commitments aligned with organizational goals.
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*:
Frequently stand/walk, sit, perform desk based computer tasks and lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 10 pounds.
Occasionally use a telephone, write by hand, twist/bend/stoop/squat, grasp lightly/fine manipulation and lift/carry/push/pull objects that weigh up to 20 pounds.
Rarely kneel, crawl, climb ladders, reach/work above shoulder, grasp forcefully, carry, push, and pull objects that weigh up to 40 pounds or more.
Ability to maintain a valid non-commercial California Driver's license.
Auditory acuity with ability to hear horns and bells.
Visual acuity with ability to determine colors for finishes.
Ability to climb scaffolding, ladders, stairs etc.
* - Consistent with its obligations under the law, the University will provide reasonable accommodation to any employee with a disability who requires accommodation to perform the essential functions of his or her job.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
May work in active laboratories or outdoor environments.
May be exposed to extreme hot and cold temperatures, be exposed to high voltage electricity, radiation or electromagnetic fields, lasers, noise > 80dB TWA, allergens/biohazards/chemicals /asbestos, or heavy metals or work on roofs at heights greater than 10 ft.
May drive vehicle day and night.
Must wear personal protective equipment as defined/required by job assignments, and dress for clean rooms.
May work extended hours, evenings and weekends.
WORK STANDARDS:
Interpersonal Skills: Demonstrates the ability to work well with Stanford colleagues and clients and with external organizations.
Promote Culture of Safety: Demonstrates commitment to personal responsibility and value for environment, safety and security; communicates related concerns; uses and promotes safe behaviors based on training and lessons learned. Meets the applicable roles and responsibilities as described in the ESH Manual, Chapter 1—General Policy and Responsibilities: http://www-group.slac.stanford.edu/esh/eshmanual/pdfs/ESHch01.pdf
Subject to and expected to comply with all applicable University policies and procedures, including but not limited to the personnel policies and other policies found in the University's Administrative Guide, http://adminguide.stanford.edu.

column3: AAA Northern California, Nevada and Utah Insurance Exchange
column5:
Overarching Duties
·        Manage and direct the full range of services, and related contractual relationships, for the design and build of AAA facilities, including architects, designers, general contractors, subs, furniture vendors, and others.
·        Manage construction/project costs by analyzing the value of the services provided, negotiating vendor contracts, value engineering the design and construction, and developing metrics to measure and understand current and future performance.
·        Implement Construction Project Management policies and procedures for all construction related functions.
·        Develop, maintain and manage services standards, Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for all third-party providers of products and/or services.
·        Ensure that the Construction Project Management activities support AAA’s overall business goals while meeting the needs and objectives of business units and functions.
Financial
·        Drive disciplined business practices to assure AAA construction project management decisions are made to maximize AAA’s real estate capital investment strategies and efficiencies.
·        Manage a pipeline of capital projects ranging between $1MM and $5MM.
·        Develop detailed annual capital budgets for all AAA NCNU’s real estate portfolio projects.
·        Develop, prepare and maintain budgets, forecasts and report financial performance relating to each construction project, including architectural, surveying and final execution of all store construction functions.
·        Monitor and manage actual costs to keep projects on track with established budgets.
·        Receive, review, code and sign vendor purchase orders and invoices, using AAA corporate processes.
·        Create cost analyses, establish expense-tracking systems, and execute cost reduction and containment.
·         Financial management of all Construction/Project Management activities.
Administration
·        Analyze workload and resource constraints to develop the optimal use of internal and external staffing (e.g. consultants, contractors) to manage work.
·        Build teams of general contractors and architects to perform on new store, retrofit and remodel projects through rigorous and consistent vetting via AAA processes.
·        Collaborate with the Corporate Real Estate peers, and Operation teams to ensure full consideration of operational issues in capital projects, from design to delivery, while working within the confines of departmental budgets.
·        Negotiate contracts with general contractors and other vendors (e.g. architects, sign and furniture vendors, etc.) and consultants.
·        Collaborate with Lease Transactions during preliminary site review for land use, adequate parking, building placement and operational feasibility.
·        Ensure construction deadlines are met in order to roll out new branch openings and/or operation site openings on schedule.
·        Supervise and direct the day-to-day work of vendors on all AAA capital projects.
·        Prepare and administer Request for Proposal (RFP) packages for vendor services and monitor work completed by vendors for construction items.
·        Maintain accurate and current records relating to Construction/Project Management activities, projects, contacts, etc.       
·        Drive and lead continuous process improvement and lean, operational excellence initiatives.
·        Manage and submit Tenant Improvement reimbursement to landlord, including final lien waivers, close out/as-built documentation and track receipt of funds.
·        Generate regular weekly, monthly and ad hoc reports relative to Construction/Project Management activities.
·        Confirm that work by Construction/Project Management team members and vendors is performed satisfactorily and corrected where deficiencies occur.
·        Review and coordinate current and upcoming jobs to ensure efficient planning, materials, labor forecasting, and coordination on jobs to ensure efficient resource allocations, financial performance and customer satisfaction.
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
A qualified candidate will have a thorough understanding of corporate construction/project management, including the following:
·        Knowledge of construction industry, principles and practices related to project estimation, labor forecasting, building permits, multiple disciplines involved in area of responsibility e.g. mechanical, electrical, plumbing, carpentry and fixtures construction.
·        Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and set and balance competing priorities with strong organization skills and ability to multi-task.
·        Demonstrated strong customer service skills, ability to proactively address customer issues and concerns.
·        Thorough knowledge of commercial construction and design, along with a demonstrated proficiency in developing new concepts and managing construction on a regional basis required.
·        Management and supervision experience in a corporate environment, with designers, engineers, contractors and vendors.
·        Detailed knowledge of construction/project management best practices, vendor management, contract management, construction finance operations, budgeting, and relationship management. 
·        Detailed knowledge of, and experience with, contracts, including knowledge of leases and construction related agreements.
·        Demonstrated ability to effectively operate in a corporate team environment including proven vision, leadership and critical thinking skills to bring creative solutions and efficiently prioritize activities in a fast paced environment.
·        Proficient with MS Word, MS Excel, MS Power Point, and MS Project.
·        Refined interpersonal skills and demonstrated service orientation.
·        Detail-oriented with solid problem-solving skills.
·        Results-oriented with a desire to learn and support new technologies and processes.
·        Effective organizational skills with ability to set priorities manage multiple projects and meet deadlines.
·        Ability to effectively interface with all departments of the company in a highly professional manner.
·        Strong communication skills, both written and oral.
·        Demonstrated business and project management skills including knowledge of automated project management tools, financial reports and general knowledge of accounting principles.
 Education & Experience / Licenses & Certification
·        BA/BS degree or equivalent experience in construction management.
·        Minimum 10+ years’ related experience in construction/project management, specifically high-volume, retail branch networks, large back office facilities and corporate facilities.
·        Valid Driver’s License
We’ll value your skills and experience. We’re building a performance organization with heart and developing a pipeline of tomorrow’s leaders. Your work will be enhanced with training opportunities, a mentoring program and our Promote-from-within philosophy. We celebrate our diversity and leverage the power of many minds.

column2: Residential Construction Project Manager - Walnut Creek, CA
column5:
Residential Construction Project Manager
Paradigm Building
Walnut Creek, CA
 Paradigm Building is different than most contractors in that we listen to our customer and discover what it is they really want, even if they aren’t totally sure. We understand our customers and work creatively to give them what they want on a budget they are comfortable with.
 We are a company that invests in our employees and rewards them for their hard work.
 How else do you think we’ve won so many customer satisfaction awards? Oh yeah, and we’re TV stars too. Catch us on the Discovery Channel and over 25 episodes on HGTV!
 We’re currently on the lookout for a Residential Construction Project Manager. Someone who can take the reins and lead a team into our next stage of massive growth. Your role will be to oversee all aspects of project construction from planning to implementation.
 We are looking for someone who wants to grow with a thriving new company and is motivated to increase their earnings as they help our company expand. A successful individual in this role can expect first-year earnings of $120 - $150k as well as the opportunity to become our Director of Construction.
 Now here’s your favorite part, and most likely the part that you skipped to without reading anything else. THE BULLET POINTS!
 Compensation & Benefits…
● Competitive base salary + lucrative bonus structure (A successful Project Manager can expect $120 - $150k first year earnings)
● Vacation and Sick days
● Health & Medical Benefits
● An awesome company culture and a chance to grow with a thriving company
 Responsibilities will include…
● Allocating resources for all ongoing projects
● Recruiting and supervising on-site personnel and subcontractors
● Interfacing with inspectors, contractors, architects, engineers, clients, and government county officials
● Negotiating with contractors to receive reasonable order costs
● Maintain high standards of workmanship that adhere to original plans and specifications
 Our ideal candidate will have…
● Previous experience in Residential Construction Management (Custom homes, remodels, multi-family)
● Strong leadership qualities
● Deadline and detail-oriented
● Previous superintendent / project management experience preferred
 A little more about us
Paradigm Building Inc. is a small, multi-million dollar construction company that has experienced solid growth over the last few years. We are based in Walnut Creek but deal with remodels and new construction projects throughout the entire East Bay Area.
 Paradigm Building’s management-oriented style focused on excellent client communication and utilizing the best building methods for each unique project makes Paradigm Building one of the Bay Area's premier custom home builders.
 Each and every one of our residential construction projects throughout the San Francisco Bay Area is built with high-end craftsmanship and a sharp focus on the homeowner’s lifestyle.

At Related, our 10-week summer internship offer students hands-on experience and a chance to work on challenging projects with some of the best minds in the business. The Related Internship Program not only places you within a specific project area, but also provides tours of our portfolio, and exposes you to our multi-faceted lines of business through an outstanding executive speaker series.

This is an excellent opportunity for you to develop valuable contacts and obtain the type of hands-on experience that will benefit you as you make important career choices.

Related’s construction management team works to provide necessary insight and input on construction schedule, cost and complexity.  They are an integral part of the development team from predevelopment through completion.  The construction team works alongside the project’s in-house design, financial and development management team to manage costs, explore building system alternatives, coordinate zoning and permits, and oversee the project’s construction bid and contract process.  Related’s strong relationships with local quality contractors and union trade groups have enabled Related to develop one of the nation’s largest and most complex developments, including Time Warner Center, and qualified the company to develop Hudson Yards.  The professionals working on these mega projects are the same as those building Related’s residential buildings, delivering the same excellence regardless of the building scale or complexity. We are committed to the highest standards of excellence and strive to always exceed customer expectations and be the best in our industry.
 Primary Responsibilities
As a Construction Management Intern, you will be staffed on a dynamic team managing the construction of one of our developments.   You will assist the Project Manager with a variety of daily tasks such as reviewing drawings and marking them up on Bluebeam or using Excel to input detailed project data.  You will also learn to manage the submittal and RFI processes as you communicate back at forth with different parties on the job.  You will get the chance to attend various meetings every week with the design team, procurement team, and subcontractors.  You will also be involved in site visits.  
Review and summarize documents including but not limited to partnership agreements, audits, and term sheets
Compile market research to draw comparisons between different properties
Participate in weekly meetings on current projects
Assist in creation, execution and monitoring project work plans and revises as required to meet changing needs and requirements
Participate in creating overall project schedule and oversees timely execution
Assist with management of day to day operational aspects of the project
Ensures project documents are complete, current, and stored appropriately

Our ideal candidate will be a rising junior or senior with the following skills:
 Degree in Construction Management or Engineering
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal
Knowledge of mechanical, electrical systems
A highly entrepreneurial, self-motivated and results-oriented individual
Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Keen Attention to Detail
High Energy; Possessed with Drive
Strong Organizational Skills
Excellent professional demeanor with the ability to work with a wide range of levels of management
A strong passion for Real Estate Development

Related Companies is an equal opportunity employer.

Since opening in 2000, the culture at Alliance has been one with an entrepreneurial spirit that consistently pushes the evolution of the multifamily industry. As a result, we’ve revolutionized the apartment living experience and continue to be recognized for delivering world-class services and exceptional customer experiences. And that’s really why we are here in the first place – to build homes, lifestyles, and opportunities for those who call Alliance home. It’s this mission that propels us forward each day, motivating us to craft work environments that are engaging, empowering, and dedicated to professional advancement.
  If you’re looking for a fast-pace, ever-evolving career that rewards grit and perseverance, you’ve come to the right place. Welcome home.
  
The Construction Project Manager assists the Construction Executives and Development Professionals in the design, budgeting, value engineering, contracting, scheduling and construction of multifamily apartment communities. As the Construction Project Manager you must be able to work closely with the construction field staff, City/Government municipal representatives, property management staff and subcontractors to ensure that the project is built on schedule, with the highest quality craftsmanship, while ensuring all applicable codes and regulations are achieved.

• Participate and contribute in development of preliminary construction estimates and budgets at various stages from conceptual to final
• Inspection and evaluation of site
• Coordinate with development to design site in a cost-effective manner
• Coordinate with architect and other professionals on preliminary and working drawing design
• Perform value engineering studying
• Coordinate with design professionals throughout plan development
• Accountable for project cost control
• Responsible for organizing and managing project buyout, including bid packages and creation of scope of work for subcontractors
• Complete final subcontracts, scopes of work, and material purchase orders
• Accountability for site staffing, including recruiting, hiring, and managing all on-site personnel
• Preliminary meetings with utility companies and site personnel to establish parameters and requirements
• Coordination of municipal approval and permitting process
• Approve all subcontractor draw requests
• Coordinate lender draw packages
• Deep, local history within the Pacific NW market and connection to relevant businesses and key persons within the Seattle and Portland construction markets

• 3+ years experience in Multifamily industry
• Extreme attention to detail
• Superior accuracy and proficiency in accounting processes

Company:
CableCom is a leading provider of engineering, construction, and testing services for coaxial and fiber optic cable systems. With headquarters in Bothell, Washington, just outside of Seattle, we have 20 locations throughout the Western Region of the US. Founded in 1978, CableCom is a subsidiary of Dycom Industries – one of the largest telecommunication infrastructure companies in the U.S., with approximately 14,000 employees and over 40 subsidiaries.
Every day at CableCom, we work to improve the way information is shared and communicated through the execution of innovative technology projects. Join us in South San Francisco, California where you can be a part of a team dedicated to providing world class customer service.
Overview:
CableCom is seeking an experienced, full-time Construction Supervisor who will lead a team for our South San Francisco, California location.  Successful candidates must have experience in underground utility work.  Candidate must be capable of working in all temperatures, climates, and weather conditions and be able to pass a background check and drug screen. We offer competitive pay and an extensive benefits package.
Responsibilities:
Supervise all operations to ensure that all construction operations are completed in accordance with customer and industry specifications. This includes ensuring that all employees working on project are working safely and productively.
Provide OJT training for employees working under your direction on construction practices and methods to ensure a safe and productive work environment.
Assign daily production to in-house and subcontract laborers and crews.
Requisition, assign and track materials needed for the daily operations.
Perform audits of construction operations to ensure work is being completed in compliance with project specifications and monitor safe work practices.
Resolve complaints with property owners in areas where our personnel are working.                                       
Review daily production reports, material usage sheets, keep track of work hours, complete and maintain accurate "as-built maps" for areas built.
Reconcile all issued parts and materials on a daily basis to ensure accurate material usage counts.
Verify submitted Daily Production Reports for accuracy and approve recorded production for billing purposes.
Willingness to work shifts as assigned, including daily overtime when necessary.
Provide verifiable evidence of experience in CATV construction field and prior supervisory experience in construction or related field.
Other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Possess a valid driver’s license (class "C" minimum) or be eligible and willing to obtain the required license for the position (possibly class "B" - light commercial)
Capable of working in all temperatures, climates, and weather conditions.
Able to perform the physical tasks required in this position for the entire assigned shift.
Standing - 6 to 8 hours daily
Walking - 4 to 6 hours daily
Climbing - 0 to 2 hours daily
Driving - 0-4 hours daily
Bending/Twisting - 0 to 2 hours daily
Pushing/Pulling - 0 to 2 hours daily
Repetitive Motion (grasping, manipulation) - 0 to 2 hours daily
Lifting (weights up to 100 lbs.) - rarely
Lift & Carry (weights of 50 to 60 lbs.) – occasionally
Must be able to pass background and drug screening.
Benefits Include:
Competitive Pay
Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Plans
Flexible Spending Accounts
Retirement Savings Plan (401K) with company matching
Stock Purchase Plan
Short & Long Term Disability
Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance
Paid Holidays and Vacation (PTO)
Educational Reimbursement
If you are interested in learning more about our organization, please visit our website www.cablecomllc.us

When you apply for this job, you will be asked to answer questions regarding your criminal background. Answering “Yes” to the criminal background questions will not automatically bar you from employment. A criminal background check will be conducted following any conditional offer of employment. Only those crimes which are substantially related to the position you are seeking will be considered. Please note that for certain contractors with whom we do business, based on the nature of their operation, the type of offense and related factors may affect your assignment to that contractor. Factors that will be taken into account include: (1) The facts or circumstances surrounding the offense or conduct; (2) the number of offenses for which you were convicted or plea was entered; (3) your age at the time of conviction or plea, or release from prison; (4) any evidence that you performed the same or similar type of work, post conviction/plea, with the same or different employers, with no known incidents of criminal conduct; (5) the length and consistency of employment history before and after the offense or conduct; (6) any rehabilitation efforts, e.g. education/training; (7) any employment or character references and any other information regarding your fitness for the particular position; and/or (8) whether you are bonded under a federal, state, or local bonding program.

For applicants residing in and/or applying for a position in a state or locality listed below, please review the specific directions below before submitting your application.

CALIFORNIA APPLICANTS: Choose the answer: "I live in and/or am applying for a job in a state that does not require an answer at this time." YOU WILL BE ASKED TO ANSWER THE CRIMINAL HISTORY QUESTIONS WHEN YOU HAVE RECEIVED A CONDITIONAL OFFER OF EMPLOYMENT.
CALIFORNIA APPLICANTS: Do not identify any misdemeanor conviction for which probation has been successfully completed or otherwise discharged and the case has been dismissed by a court. Also, do not identify marijuana related convictions entered by the court more than 2 years ago that involve: unlawful possession of marijuana; transportation or giving away of up to 28.5 grams of marijuana, other than concentrated cannabis, or the offering to transport or give away up to 28.5 grams of marijuana, other than concentrated cannabis; possession of paraphernalia used to smoke marijuana; being in a place with knowledge that marijuana was being used; or being under the influence of marijuana. Also, do not identify any arrest or detention that did not result in a conviction or any record of a referral to, and participation in, any pretrial or post trial diversion program.
California: LOS ANGELES APPLICANTS: Choose the answer: "I live in and/or am applying for a job in a state that does not require an answer at this time." YOU WILL BE ASKED TO ANSWER THE CRIMINAL HISTORY QUESTIONS WHEN YOU HAVE RECEIVED A CONDITIONAL OFFER OF EMPLOYMENT.
California: SAN FRANCISCO APPLICANTS: Choose the answer: "I live in and/or am applying for a job in a state that does not require an answer at this time." YOU WILL BE ASKED TO ANSWER THE CRIMINAL HISTORY QUESTIONS AFTER THE FIRST INTERVIEW. When answering such questions, please do not disclose any misdemeanor and felony convictions that occurred more than seven years prior to the inquiry or : (a) arrests other than those which charges are still pending, (b) completion of any diversion program, (c) sealed or juvenile offenses, or (d) infractions that are not felonies or misdemeanors.)

CONNECTICUT APPLICANTS: Do not identify any arrest, criminal charge or conviction the records of which have been erased by a court based on sections 46b-146, 54-76o or 54-142a of the Connecticut General Statutes. Criminal records subject to erasure under these sections are records concerning a finding of delinquency or the fact that a child was a member of a family with service needs, an adjudication as a youthful offender, a criminal charge that was dismissed or not prosecuted, a criminal charge for which the person was found not guilty, or a conviction for which the offender received an absolute pardon. Any person whose criminal records have been judicially erased under one or more of these sections is deemed to have never been arrested within the meaning of the law as it applies to the particular proceedings that have been erased, and may so swear under oath.

GEORGIA APPLICANTS: Do not identify any verdict or plea of guilty or nolo contendere that was discharged by the court under Georgia's First Offender Act.

HAWAII APPLICANTS: Choose the answer: "I live in and/or am applying for a job in a state that does not require an answer at this time." YOU WILL BE ASKED TO ANSWER THE CRIMINAL HISTORY QUESTIONS WHEN YOU HAVE RECEIVED A CONDITIONAL OFFER OF EMPLOYMENT. Please limit your responses to any convictions within the past 10 years, excluding any period of time when you were incarcerated.

IOWA APPLICANTS: Convictions will not automatically be a bar to employment, but the job, and the time, nature and seriousness of the crime will be considered.

MARYLAND APPLICANTS: UNDER MARYLAND LAW, AN EMPLOYER MAY NOT REQUIRE OR DEMAND, AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYMENT OR CONTINUED EMPLOYMENT, THAT ANY INDIVIDUAL SUBMIT TO OR TAKE A LIE DETECTOR OR SIMILAR TEST. AN EMPLOYER WHO VIOLATES THIS LAW IS GUILTY OF A MISDEMEANOR AND SUBJECT TO A FINE NOT EXCEEDING $100.

MASSACHUSETTS APPLICANTS: Choose the answer: "I live in and/or am applying for a job in a state that does not require an answer at this time." YOU WILL BE ASKED TO ANSWER THE CRIMINAL HISTORY QUESTIONS WHEN YOU HAVE RECEIVED A CONDITIONAL OFFER OF EMPLOYMENT. You also do not have to identify prior arrests, court appearances and adjudications in cases of delinquency or as a child in need of services which did not result in a complaint transferred to the superior court for criminal prosecution. You also do not have to identify (1) an arrest, detention or disposition regarding any violation of law in which no conviction resulted; (2) first-time misdemeanor convictions for drunkenness, simple assault, speeding, minor traffic violations, affray or disturbance of the peace; and (3) convictions for other misdemeanors where the date of conviction or the end of any period of incarceration was more than 5 years ago, unless there have been subsequent convictions within those 5 years.
It is unlawful in Massachusetts to require or administer a lie detector test as a condition of employment or continued employment. An employer who violates this law shall be subject to criminal penalties and civil liability.

column2: Project Administrator / Accountant – Impact the construction industry!
column5:
If you’re an individual who excels at communications and task management, ensuring that all tasks are documented thoroughly, completed accurately, and delivered in a timely manner – then we want to meet you!
Position Responsibilities:
Provide administrative support for construction operations including loan draws, tracking and coordination of vendor and subcontractor contract paperwork including payment submittals.
Lead Coordinator on assigned project for subcontractor enrollment and participation process.
Support senior financial management for inventory accounting calculations and monthly tracking.
Manage monthly project information in Yardi accounting system, ensuring accurate cost coding.
Coordinate ordering of specialty materials and tracking major deliveries as required.
Review available information to project cost to date and cost to complete.
Manage document history on multiple, concurrent projects in conformance with company processes and procedures.
Maintain project correspondence, contracts and deliveries/invoices at the project level.
Provide administrative support to the General Superintendent as needed.
Provide supervision and guidance to junior level Administrative staff when opportunity arises.
Ad hoc special projects as needed.
Experience and knowledge that will provide a foundation for success long-term:
Familiarity / exposure with construction contract review process and construction job cycle
Comfort calling vendors and subcontractors for inquiries and requests
Working knowledge of MS Excel (comfortable with formulas, spreadsheet formatting, etc)
Ability to work flexibly, proactively and collaboratively – you’ll be part of a cohesive team!
Keen ability to prioritize and assess situations to quickly resolve issues of concern for the project management team (sense of urgency and responsibility)
Qualifications – Additional experience and education to bring to the job:
Bachelor’s Degree
Experience with Yardi and ProCore software platforms a plus
 While this positionreports to the Controller, this person works closely with the construction team members, including Project Managers, Engineers, and Superintendents, providing a well-rounded approach to the delivery of the company’s product line to market.
 Our compensation is very competitive. We offer medical, competitive PTO time, commuter benefits, 401k Match and eligibility for annual bonuses as well as the opportunity to make a difference in a company where your position is critical to project success!  
About the Company
JS Sullivan is a privately owned, long-term legacy, entrepreneurial and successful real estate development and construction company specializing in ground-up development of urban infill condominiums in the San Francisco area.
  Hire Education Consulting Group LLC is assisting JS Sullivan with this search.

Why CDM Smith?
CDM Smith provides lasting and integrated solutions in water, environment, transportation, energy and facilities to public and private clients worldwide. As a full-service consulting, engineering, construction, and operations firm, we deliver exceptional client service, quality results and enduring value across the entire project life cycle.

Job Description
CDM Smith is pursuing a senior construction manager to join our established team of accomplished professionals. Construction management experience in wastewater is highly desired. As a member of our team, this individual will provide technical expertise to the firm, and leadership to a staff of construction representatives and project support staff. The individual will plan, direct, and coordinate construction projects ranging from large multi-discipline projects to moderately complex.

Responsibilities:

- Coordinate and control all construction management activities including CPM scheduling, claims management, project coordination, risk management, and quality management on a large complex construction management assignment.
- Communicate and interface with internal/external team members and authorities involved in the planning, design, execution and construction activities.
- Manage, monitor, and track project objectives including scope of work, schedule and budget.
- Serve as the primary contact for the Client and home office staff.
- Build the project team including sub-consultants and subcontractors and manage their duties and activities.
- Ensure that construction is completed in accordance with the Contract Documents and CDM Smith Quality Standards.
- Manage resources and budget effectively contributing to the overall profitability of the firm.
- Establish processes and procedures to reduce cost, limit risks and provide a safe work environment for our staff.
- Mentor staff and contribute to the firm’s knowledge management system.
- Assist in development of a construction management network in the Southern California area.

Minimum Qualifications
- Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering or Construction Management and 10 Years of experience in construction or Project Management Professional certification from the Project Management Institute (PMI) and 15 years of construction experience or a Certified Construction Manager (CCM) from the Construction Management Association of America (CMAA) and 15 years of experience of construction experience or 22 years of construction experience in lieu of degree.
- PE desired.
- Excellent oral and written communication skills
- Proven leadership abilities
- Excellent understanding of alternative delivery construction methods
- Ability to work independently, oversee construction contractors, manage a staff of construction representatives and project support staff, oversee controls staff including master scheduling and budgets, and prepare high-level reports to the client and governing entities
- Job requires site visits.

EEO Statement
We attract the best people in the industry, supporting their efforts to learn and grow. We strive to create a challenging and progressive work environment. We provide career opportunities that span a variety of disciplines and geographic locations, with projects that our employees plan, design, build and operate—as diverse as the needs of our clients. CDM Smith is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Agency Disclaimer
All vendors must have a signed CDM Smith Placement Agreement from the CDM Smith Recruitment Center Manager to receive payment for your placement. Verbal or written commitments from any other member of the CDM Smith staff will not be considered binding terms. All unsolicited resumes sent to CDM Smith and any resume submitted to any employee outside of CDM Smith Recruiting Center Team (RCT) will be considered property of CDM Smith. CDM Smith will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

PULLMAN, A Structural Group Company, integrates technology-driven, engineered solutions into its industry-leading contracting services. PULLMAN’s capabilities include specialty design-build services for new and existing structures, as well as a wide range of specialty repair and maintenance services. With offices located throughout the United States, and as a signatory to local, national, and international labor agreements, PULLMAN has the track record and the experience to meet our customers’ specialty contracting needs.
If you are seeking a challenging and rewarding career opportunity with a dynamic, diversified and innovative company, the PULLMAN Project Engineer Career Program may be for you!  We are currently recruiting for an Entry Level Construction Project Engineer to be based in our Bay Area office located in Benicia, CA.
As a Construction Project Engineer, you will apply your knowledge and develop new skills while working on a variety of challenging projects.  The PECD Program with PULLMAN will provide you the opportunity to customize your career path based on your interests and career goals. From day one, you will be exposed to all aspects of construction in a variety of environments. By providing you with mentors in different areas of our business, you will attain a well-rounded knowledge that will offer boundless opportunities for your professional development.
As a Project Engineer with PULLMAN, you will develop skills in:
Project Management
Estimating
Budget preparation and job cost control
Scheduling and production rate tracking
Safety and quality control management
Engineering design and support
Business development and client relations
Successful candidates must meet the following criteria to be considered for this position:
A Bachelors degree in Engineering (Civil, Structural, Mechanical Geotechnical), Construction Management, Industrial Technology or related field of study
Cumulative GPA of 2.8 or higher
A minimum of one construction or design related internship experience
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Excellent documentation and organizational skills
Strong computer skills
Ability to travel 20 %
Our ideal candidate is an innovative but decisive individual who can work effectively in a highly collaborative, team-based environment; has the ability to set goals and expectations and hold others accountable; can encourage and mentor others; is approachable, empathetic and outgoing; can quickly gain trust and respect; and is able to establish and maintain relationships.
PULLMAN, A Structural Group Company, is proud of a company culture that promotes 24/7 safety and quality.  We offer competitive compensation and benefits including medical and dental insurance, 401(k), paid holidays & vacation, tuition reimbursement, career development and growth opportunities, and a caring work environment.
EOE/M/F/D/V

Business TitleField Construction ManagerRequisition Number37180BRSalary PlanCNSGrade005DivisionBVCIEmployee TypeFull TimeTraining and CertificationsOSHA TrainingVisa Sponsorship Available?NoRelocation Available?NoDivision Marketing StatementBVCI, a proud part of the BV family of companies, offers union shop construction services for on-time, on-budget project delivery.

Our professionals deliver solid dependable solutions for industrial construction projects of all sizes, enabling us to provide leading construction services for our clients. Together, we have an integrated approach to project execution with an emphasis on safety, quality, cost, and schedule.

Our Services
We work with our clients on EPC as well as construction-only projects. We self-perform projects by executing direct hire labor as well as utilizing subcontractor elements.

We continue to expand our services offered and build our project backlog.

Now is the time to work at BVCI!Primary PurposeResponsible for coordination of the construction on the project. Coordinates compliance with the schedule, safety, cost, and quality decisions in conjunction with the Project Field Manager or Operations Manager.Principal Duties and Responsibilities• Manages and coordinates all on-site construction activities for compliance with the CPM schedule and monitors and enforces compliance with contract requirements; Implements the Project Construction Execution Plan. Directs field staff in the daily, weekly planning process.
• Supervises and mentors all superintendents; monitors their activities and provides leadership.
• Monitors and reports on construction productivity and schedule performance (including trends) to the Project Field Manager, Operations Manager and Project Controls Manager. Takes actions necessary to meet project budget and schedule requirements.
• Directs and approves the development and implementation of construction schedule recovery plans as required.
• Coordinates the Construction Completion Walkdowns and the complete hand over of start-up packages to the Startup Manager and supervises the close out of all punch list items.
• Assists Project Field Manager with client interface and relations.
• Coordinates with Material Manager to review all procured materials for acceptance. Reviews and approves equipment rentals (if supplied by company) and coordinates shared use of this equipment with subcontractors.
• Conducts weekly coordination meeting with field staff & subcontractors.
• Conducts weekly staff & subcontractor meetings.
• Reports weekly schedule and commodity installation status to the Project Controls Manager.
• Monitors all extra work authorization requests, back charges, and supplier and subcontractor progress/final payment requests for acceptance and is responsible for subordinates providing the timely tracking information to Project Controls to support the change management system.
• Adheres to Safety, Quality, Ethical Standards, Lessons Learned, and Performance Management programs in accordance with Division Policies, Standards, Guides, and Contractual commitments.
• Monitors and approve all CIR replies to the subcontractors.
• Responsible for completion of the construction punchlist.
• Has full knowledge of the safety program and acts as the Safety Representative on site in the absence of the regular Safety Supervisor.
• Has general knowledge of all disciplines of construction and is able to stand in for each lead discipline.
• Resolves safety and quality issues with the safety and quality managers. Further disputes are then deferred to the Project Field Manager or Division Safety manager.
• Understands the major commercial and deliverable terms of the construction subcontracts and manages within these terms.
• Monitors and controls overtime by his subordinates and subcontractors.
• Writes the construction portion of the client and construction monthly report.
• Coordinates with the Field Engineers or home office engineers on engineering deliverables
• Responsible for the effective management of construction Manufacturer’s Service Technicians and the timesheet tracking.
• Supports continuous improvement efforts and the change management effects associated with the implementation of improvements.; Supervises work of others. Responsible for discipline, and pay administration of their subordinates.
• Supervises work of others. Responsible for hiring, discipline, and pay administration of their subordinates.

The Director of Construction ensures the on-time and on-budget completion of assigned construction and new development projects by managing all activities related to the planning, building, budgeting/financial, safety and code compliance of the assigned new construction and development projects. project timetable, and supervising the construction and renovations work through completion.

Education

College degree in business, real estate, finance, marketing, or related field and/or equivalent experience is preferred, with a current General Contractor’s license.

Qualifications

Demonstrated ability to read, write, and communicate effectively to develop, comprehend, and complete legal, financial, construction-related, and human resources documents and to provide updates and reports to owners and key business leaders.
Demonstrated proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet, and database management programs in order to complete required reports and employment documents. Experience in Timberline, On-screen Take-off, scheduling and other Company software applications related to budgeting and overall project management.
Demonstrated mathematical skills necessary to add, subtract, multiply, and divide numbers, decimals, and fractions, and calculate percents in order to complete financial records, budgets, and other fiscal reporting information.
Demonstrated management and supervisory skills sufficient to lead, direct, evaluate, and mentor subordinate and peer employee staff.
Solid knowledge and understanding of the development and new construction business from both a technical standpoint, and from a project management standpoint.


About Us

Greystar® is the global leader in multifamily real estate, offering expertise in property management, investment management, and development and construction of rental housing. Established in 1993, Greystar is the largest property management operator in the world. Its dedicated team members and a commitment to hiring the very best multifamily professionals has resulted in record growth, making Greystar one of the most respected and trusted real estate companies. EOE.

Locations
Home Office - San Francisco, CA 94105 US (Primary)
Job Title
Senior Construction Management Leader
Job Type
Full-time
Job Description
There’s a little bit of magic in the air at Gymboree Group. We’re focusing on our future, from evolving our brands to transforming the way we work together. We may be grown-ups, but we’re all about celebrating children and the people who care for them. We love to collaborate to find new ways to make our customers smile. Have great ideas? We want to hear them. Want to try a new approach? Let’s do it. Come join the fun at our home office!
 What You’ll Do
In this role, you willbe a key team member in delivering premium stores from initial design through construction and store opening.  The PM Supervisor will work closely with the PM team in all facets of project development from initial site assessment through store opening.   
 Responsibilities include:
Lead role in the bidding and construction phases of all projects, establishing best practices to meet the rigors of current design, expectations and industry trends
Provide strategic and tactical support to the Store Design & Construction team and helping to define and establish team and project standards
Oversee the Construction Project Management team to ensure alignment of resources and project load
Provide strategic oversight and mentoring to the Construction Project Management team to ensure best practices and consistency with Gymboree Group’s design and construction standards
Ensure consistency across the entire project management team in design, documentation and construction
Involved in the initial phase of the store delivery process, assess new sites for fit and develop layouts, review and comment on LOD’s and LOI’s
Review all relevant exhibits that comprise the “Landlord Tenant Packages” such as Lease Outline Drawings, Tenant Criteria, and As-Builts or Base Building Drawings, ensure compliance and maintain design standards and negotiate with Landlords and Tenant Coordinators when necessary to ensure a best possible design
Review and understand all permitting requirements and initiate all projects with our consultant architects and engineers, negotiate contracts and formally engage service providers
Manage the design development, present designs for internal review and approval and ensure dissemination of relevant documents to all internal business partners
Manage and report on all design and construction activity to ensure the timely delivery of new projects
Ensure compliance with all pre-construction work including follow-up on Landlord work and space delivery scope and dates prior to construction start
Oversee the construction bid process to general contractors, receive all bids, and compile bid summaries, level bids, qualify bids and provide a recommendation to the Director of Store Design & Construction and the VP of Stores.
Review and approve all consultant invoices and progress payments in Gymboree’s Store Project Tracking System.
Manage and report all updates on the Store Opening Forecast.
Manage and track Construction Budgets, spend to date, invoices paid, committed funds and change orders
Assume responsibility for any additional design and construction related projects such as the design prototype, materials library, standard details and communicate to team, development of new fixtures…
Track development of drawings and permitting to ensure the timely delivery for the start of construction
Review, comment and approve shop drawings as necessary
Job Requirements
What You’ll Bring
4-year Bachelor’s Degree in Architecture or Construction or equivalent on-the-job training and a minimum (10) years experience in the retail and/or construction industry, project management and team building and supervision of in-house direct reports
Thorough command of reading construction documents and doing material take-offs as required and working knowledge of construction means and methods.
Demonstrate exceptional written and verbal communication skills, analytical and presentation skills
Develop and maintain exceptional collaborative relationships with all internal and external team members.  Ability to effectively lead external service providers in delivering projects on time and on budget
Competency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Project and AutoCAD
Highly organized and detail oriented
10-15% Travel required to visit sites under construction as needed to effectively manage projects
Proven track record of managing professional teams in-house and external consultants
Proven ability to develop team members professionally
 Why You’ll Love Working With Us
The Product—so good, you’ll be using your employee discount more than you probably should
The People—ask anyone that works here…we have incredible people on our team
The Experience—you’ll enjoy a rewarding career at a respected global children’s brand
The Benefits—health insurance, 401k match, and onsite wellness services for your convenience
 Let’s Talk Perks!
Generous Health Savings Account (HSA) employer contributions for individuals and families
Flexible Spending Accounts and commuter benefits
Paid holidays and flexible time off
30% off merchandise employee discount (Gymboree & Outlet, Janie and Jack, Crazy 8 & Outlet)
Gymboree Play & Music class discounts
Educational Assistance Development Program
Life insurance (self, spouse/domestic partner, children)
Additional corporate discounts at participating companies
 More About Us
Gymboree Group, Inc. is a specialty retailer, operating stores with high-quality clothes and accessories for children. Our family of brands includes Gymboree, Janie and Jack, and Crazy 8. Since our start in 1976, we have grown from offering mom-and-baby classes in the San Francisco Bay Area to currently operating over 900 retail stores in the United States and Canada, along with franchises around the world. We believe that respect for the customer, respect for the brand, and respect for each other are at the core of everything we do.
  Gymboree Group, Inc. is unable to provide relocation assistance for this position.                  
Principals Only. EOE. No phone calls please.

column2: CDL Class A or B Truck Driver - Construction Industry
column5:
Overview
Join an industry where training, great wages, benefits, and career development are all part of this opportunity! Hiring is at an all time high in construction. This national construction leader, recognized for staying ahead of the construction market with leading sustainable and innovative solutions, is seeking experienced CDL Truck Driver candidates.  Following the completion of training, the Truck Drivers are responsible for the load and delivery of aggregate or ready mix products to construction job sites using safe and efficient procedures.
Responsibilities
Prepares truck for operation by inspecting general conditions; checking fluid levels and tire pressure; obtaining or scheduling required repairs; validating adherence to road-ability standards on accordance with DOT regulations 
Loads truck with ready mix concrete according to prescribed procedures, including charging hopper and checking slump.
Safely drives truck in and out of areas with heavy pedestrian traffic and various construction obstacles.
Delivers items identifying destinations; establishing route; operating truck; maintaining schedule.
Discharge concrete, involving removing extension chutes, placing on main chute.
Wash residue from truck using washout system.
Maintains truck operating efficiency by completing preventive maintenance requirements. 
Maintains safe operation and clean appearance by complying with organization operational policies, procedures and standards, as well as state and local driving rules and regulations; cleans truck exterior and interior.
Completes driving logs in accordance with DOT regulations; obtains receipts acknowledgements; and completes other forms as required.
Experience with manual transmission required.
Qualifications
Must be 21 years of age due to anticipated interstate routing.
Minimum of one year directly related experience required.
High school diploma or GED preferred.
Valid Class A CDL and appropriate state driver license and tanker endorsements preferred. Class B license a must.
No more than 3 moving violations in the past three years, with no alcohol or drug related offenses, such as a DUI or DWI. Less than 2 points on record.
Must pass a drug and alcohol pre test and random testing.

Vanir Construction Management, Inc. has been exceeding client expectations for 35 years. Our progressive growth and quality of service has led Vanir to become consistently ranked among the top construction management firms in the nation by Engineering News-Record. As we continue growing into new areas and markets, our focus is to maintain a team of creative, ambitious, and visionary individuals.

The Assistant Construction Manager provides assistance in the planning, coordination and direction for construction management activities on projects to ensure they are on time, budget, schedule, cost, and project performance to ensure the requirements for the contract. Provides administration to maintain management and project facilitation for the successful completion per compliance, contractual, owner and Vanir requirements. This position reports to the Construction Manager, Project Manager, and/or Project Director, or assigned project leadership. The Assistant Construction Manager may supervise activities of project administrative staff and/or Field/Project Engineers. This position will support construction in the Education Sector.
  Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Maintain knowledge of contracts, drawings, estimates, and specifications to ensure relation and compliance to construction/project requirements
Using Client’s Software - Obtains, maintains, and administers the data, information, communications, and approvals required by project and company requirements between owner, architects, engineers, contractors/subcontractors, or other project related entities
Provide support to coordinate, direct and monitor activities of contractors/subcontractors, engineers, architects and related performing entities
Provide project controls, cost, and performance activities and procedures support and administration
Coordinate, direct and monitor activities of moving classrooms, offices and other school facilities between two school sites
Participate in project meetings to include documentation, administration, and tracking of relevant information and statuses
Monitor and report contractor, architect, engineer, and provider contractual requirements on areas of Daily reports, safety, performance, project staff, and equipment
Provide administration and processing of project logistics, organization, safety, and manpower utilization
Ensure project closeout to secure guarantees, warranties, and related provisions for final project delivery to owner entities
Oversee related activities and tasks as necessary
Provide all services and objectives for the application of Vanir’s quality services
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Construction Management or Architecture is required
Minimum of 3 years of experience as an Assistant Construction Manager is required
Experience with K-12 projects in California is highly preferred
Knowledge of construction contracts, drawings, estimates, and specifications is required
Knowledge of project controls/scheduling, documentation, engineering/construction principles, techniques, materials, applications, and practices is required
Construction contract administration experience is required
Safety training is requiredStrong computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite products, and experience with project-related Construction Management systems such as Eadocs, Prolog, or Impact is preferred
Construction Manager in Training (CMIT) is preferred

If you're interested in working for Vanir Construction Management, Inc., please visit our website to learn more and to apply online at www.vanir.com.
